projects.name: Analyzing Policy Distillation on Multi-Task Learning and Meta-Reinforcement Learning in Meta-World
text: This paper applied Divide-and-Conquer, a recent policy distillation algorithm, on Meta-World multi-task and meta-reinforcement learning benchmarks. We achieved state-of-the-art results with the MT-10 benchmark.

projects.name: DynaPEARL
text: DynaPEARL explores model-based RL with the PEARL meta-learning algorithm.

projects.name: Acroquad
text: Built for my EE 106A final project, Acroquad is a drone controlled by computer vision. It takes in input from its camera, processes the movement, and actuates in predefined responses to the commands.

projects.name: YouTube Controls
text: A Chrome extension that extends the YouTube video player. In addition to the basic Pause/Play functions, it allows setting custom speed and skip values and skipping ads. Perfect for watching lecture webcasts, or just for everyday use!

projects.name: Dead Man's Switch
text: Developed for CalHacks 2017, Dead Man's Switch is a safety mobile application. Users can set alarms that notify emergency contacts if they are not dismissed in time by the user.

projects.name: Equation Parser
text: An equation parser based on Reverse Polish notation.

projects.name: Image Averager
text: Inspired by Google Image loading screens and Android contact background colors, Image Averager converts input images into monochrome images of the average color.

projects.name: TaylordImages
text: A semi-joke Chrome Extension that replaces all images on a webpage with similarly-proportioned pictures of Taylor Swift.

projects.name: Ca1
text: A joke Chrome Extension that replaces any mention of UC Berkeley with "The Number One Public University in the World."

projects.name: Twitter Sentiment Map
text: Developed for CalHacks 2016, the Twitter Sentiment Map uses k-means clustering and sentiment scores from IBM Watson to plot the emotional distribution of the US on a map.
